description.narrative:
Recognizing the increasingly important role of rattan/bamboo sector in economic, social and environment aspects, Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC) and Oxfam launched a 3-year project #Up-scaling of pro-poor rattan/bamboo value chain development for women and ethnic minorities# to improve livelihoods and market access of more than 3,000 poor and ethnic households in these value chains. Since the beginning in 2013, various project activities have been delivered effectively and significant impact and positive results have been well achieved, greatly contributing to poverty reduction in Nghe An: 3,006 farmers had increased their average annual income by VND 10.31 million/person and diversified their livelihoods through their involvement in improved rattan/bamboo valuechain. To sustain and scale up impressive results of the project, in April 2015, SDC approves the additional fund for supplementaryintervention called #Supporting to sustainable management and responsible production practices in Lung bamboo sector in Quy Chau, Que Phong district, Nghe An province# from now until June 2016. This supplementary resource will directly address existing challengesin Lung bamboo sector in Quy Chau and Que Phong district, further contribute to strengthening the achievement of original project#soutcomes and overall goal.
Given the fact that lacking good scientific planning and management strategies is one of the largest challenges of Lung bamboo sector in Quy Chau and Que Phong district, Oxfam in cooperation with the Research Centre for Non Timber Forest Products (NTFPRC) will lay more emphasis on supporting local authorities in conducting studies on Lung bamboo issues. This will be inputs for local authorities of 2 districts to improve their bamboo sector planning and development strategies. In addition, various workshops and dialogues with policy makers, events for sharing and disseminating research and project documents/reports will alsobe organized to contribute effectively to mainstream global quality standards into industry regulations and local government#s policies.

participating-org.narrative: The Research Centre for Non Timber Forest Products (NTFPRC) is a state scientific organzation under the Vietnamese Academy of Forest Science. It has legality and legal entity to reserve the right to use their own stamp and open their own account at Vietnam StateTreasury and bank for operation according to Vietnam#s regulation. NTFPRC has function of research, technology transfer, international cooperation and consultant service. It participates in training about non timber forest product over the country, under the regulation. The organizational structure of NTFPRC includes: Department of Administration and Acounting, Department of Non Timber ForestProducts Resource Management Division, Department of NTFP breeding and cultivation technology; Department of NTFP harvesting and post-processing technology, Department of NTFP chemistry, and Hoanh Bo experimental research station at Quang Ninh province with 227 hactares of forest and forest land, Bao Yen Rattan and Bamboo research station at Lao Cai province with 202 hectares of forest and forest land. The Headquarter located at No 8, Chuong Duong Do street, Hoan Kiem district, Hanoi.
The Research Centre for Non Timber Forest Products

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

receiver-org.narrative: The Research Centre for Non Timber Forest Products
